Text: RE Invitation to Speak at Infocasts upcoming Market Price Volatility programOK I appreciate your keeping us in mind Thanks Ron Original Message From Vince J Kaminski mailto Sent Wednesday January AM To Cc Vince J Kaminski Subject RE Invitation to Speak at Infocasts upcoming Market Price Volatility program Ron We are really swamped and I would like to keep our involvement in conferences to a reasonable minimum I can promise that we shall help you with a future conference if it happens to be in Houston Vince Ron Henderson on PM Please respond to To Vince J CT cc Subject RE Invitation to Speak at Infocasts upcoming Market Price Volatility program Vince I am sorry you cant join us Is there someone on your staff who might be able to do the presentation A Real Options Approach to Asset Valuation scheduled for Thursday May th from am to pm Ron Original Message From Vince J Kaminski mailto Sent Monday January AM To Cc Vince J Kaminski Shirley Crenshaw Subject Re Invitation to Speak at Infocasts upcoming Market Price Volatility program File Draft Agenda vdoc Ron I am sorry to inform you that due to a scheduling conflict I cannot speak at this conference I want to thank you for considering me as a speaker Vince Kaminski Ron Henderson on PM Please respond to To Vince J CT cc Subject Invitation to Speak at Infocasts upcoming Market Price Volatility program Hi Vince I would like to invite you or one of your staff to be a speaker at Infocasts upcoming conference Market Price Volatility How to Model Assess and Manage Price Volatility in Todays Power Markets scheduled for May in Chicago I am attaching a copy of the draft program agenda for your review As you may note we wish to take our recent Houston meeting a step farther by making this next session a more technicallyoriented meeting There are two spots you may wish to consider The session entitled Case Study in Modeling Volatility scheduled for Wednesday May th from to pm You will note below what we had in mind for the case study The talk A Real Options Approach to Asset Valuation scheduled for Thursday May th from am to pm I am running behind schedule in finalizing this program so I will give you a call shortly to follow up with you If you wish please feel free to call me at ext I hope you can join us Ron Henderson Infocast ext CASE STUDY GUIDELINES Model should be for a particular market Examples PJM Chicago ECAR Southern California B optional Model should be for a particular purpose Examples valuing a new combustion turbine at the FloridaGeorgia border bidding on a portfolio of power plants up for sale in NEPOOL valuing a retail portfolio in Pennsylvania Model should be estimated on a particular data set Examples daily NYMEX close prices for Palo Verde PJM hourly spot prices for Case study should describe several candidate models for volatility andor market price that were considered Case study should discuss why these models were considered Candidate models should be described mathematically and verbally Evaluation criteria for choosing among the models should be explicitly identified and quantified to the extent possible Examples of evaluation criteria residuals that are not autorcorrelated stationarity Rsquared Akaike information criterion Parameter estimates for each candidate model should be displayed The estimation procedure employed should be briefly described Some diagnostics of model fit visavis data set should be presented If possible predictive power of model should be assessed Generally the case study should include all of the items above The case study may include other things
